alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND...MONTOUR AND COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Bloomsburg to Danville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Berwick, Danville, Elysburg, Riverside, Catawissa, Mifflinville, Lightstreet, Almedia, Fernville, Mechanicsville, Buckhorn, Numidia, Jerseytown, Rupert, Slabtown, Rohrsburg, Iola, Mainville and Eyers Grove. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
